title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, of Newton, charged with unlicensed medical practice and performing unsafe cosmetic surgery in Allston.
Wang faces assault, kidnapping, and larceny charges after allegedly causing permanent damage to a 22-year-old during surgery.
Authorities claim Wang falsely advertised as a licensed physician and obtained loans with misrepresented licenses.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda was struck by an MBTA train near Plymouth St. in Abington after breaking down on the tracks.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. and involved a train colliding with an unoccupied vehicle, Transit Police reported.
The 35-year-old driver exited the vehicle and left the scene before the collision; no injuries were reported.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman was hit and killed by a car while walking on Route 28 in Wareham, MA.
The woman was struck after a black truck's mirror knocked pedestrians down; snow-covered sidewalks forced them into the road.
An investigation is ongoing; the Volvo occupants were not at fault due to unavoidable conditions, according to the DA.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to 4 years in prison for child pornography charge.
Aiello was found with over 200 files on an encrypted thumb drive and accessed a child porn site.
He pleaded guilty in October 2025 and was placed on administrative leave in April 2025.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven people are presumed dead after the Gloucester fishing boat 'Lily Jean' sank off Cape Ann.
The U.S. Coast Guard and NTSB are investigating the sinking; the probe is expected to take months.
State Sen. Bruce Tarr confirmed the victims' identities, calling them 'the finest kind' for their dedication to the sea.

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Bill Belichick missed first-ballot induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026.
93% of over 450 Boston.com readers felt Belichick deserved Hall of Fame induction this year.
Readers cited Belichick's coaching accolades, while some mentioned controversies affecting his legacy.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: New England Patriots fans are invited to share their most memorable Super Bowl moments with Boston.com.
Notable Patriots Super Bowl moments include Adam Vinatieri's 2002 kick and Tom Brady's comeback against the Atlanta Falcons.
Fans can submit their stories via a form or email to potentially feature in a future article on Boston.com.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise awareness of stroke and heart disease.
Lang overcame a heart arrhythmia diagnosis in 2006 and later battled antiphospholipid syndrome, a disorder increasing her risk of strokes.
Lang is fundraising for Tedy's Team to support stroke and heart disease research and community outreach efforts.

title: Once a patient, now a runner: She’s running for Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Molly Kokoski, 26, is running the Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital.
Kokoski, a former patient, was treated for ulcerative colitis and now has an ostomy bag.
Living in Boston, Kokoski aims to inspire others by completing the race despite her medical challenges.

title: Saks OFF 5th to close Massachusetts stores
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Saks OFF 5th is closing its Somerville and Wrentham locations as parent company Saks Global files for bankruptcy.
Saks Global will focus on luxury retail and full-price operations, closing most Saks OFF 5th and all Last Call stores.
Saks Global secured $1.75 billion in financing to maintain operations while restructuring its company debt.
